citation.article-title: Sulfurihydrogenibium yellowstonense sp. nov., an extremely thermophilic, facultatively heterotrophic, sulfur-oxidizing bacterium from Yellowstone National Park, and emended descriptions of the genus Sulfurihydrogenibium, Sulfurihydrogenibium subterraneum and Sulfurihydrogenibium azorense.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Sulfurihydrogenibium
The description remains as given by Takai et al. (2003), with the following modifications: facultatively heterotrophic.
Able to utilize sulfur compounds as electron donors and molecular oxygen as an electron acceptor.
Some species can use other electron donors and acceptors.
